hints_html: This is a special integration by parts. Note that another notation for \(\displaystyle \tan^{-1}x\) is \(\displaystyle \arctan x\)
hints_latex:
This is a special integration by parts. Note that another notation for
$\displaystyle \tan^{-1}x$ is $\displaystyle \arctan  x$
hints_raw: This is a special integration by parts. Note that another notation for <math> \displaystyle \tan^{-1}x </math> is <math> \displaystyle \arctan  x</math>
question: 6 (a)
sols_html:
From now on, we will use \(\displaystyle \arctan x\) instead of \(\displaystyle \tan^{-1} x\). By integration by parts, set \(\displaystyle u = \arctan x\) and \(\displaystyle dv = dx\). Then \(\displaystyle du = \frac{1}{1+x^2} \ dx\) and \(\displaystyle v = x\). Then

\[\begin{aligned} \int_0^1 \arctan x \ dx &= x\arctan x \big|_0^1 - \int_0^1 \frac{x}{1+x^2} \ dx \\ &= \arctan(1)-\frac{1}{2}\ln|1+x^2|\big|_0^1 \\ &= \frac{\pi}{4}-\frac{1}{2}\ln 2\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
From now on, we will use $\displaystyle \arctan x$ instead of
$\displaystyle \tan^{-1} x$. By integration by parts, set
$\displaystyle u = \arctan x$ and $\displaystyle dv = dx$. Then
$\displaystyle du = \frac{1}{1+x^2} \ dx$ and $\displaystyle v = x$.
Then

\begin{align*}
\int_0^1 \arctan x \ dx &= x\arctan x \big|_0^1 - \int_0^1 \frac{x}{1+x^2} \ dx \\
&= \arctan(1)-\frac{1}{2}\ln|1+x^2|\big|_0^1 \\
&= \frac{\pi}{4}-\frac{1}{2}\ln 2
\end{align*}
sols_raw:
From now on, we will use <math> \displaystyle \arctan x </math> instead of <math> \displaystyle \tan^{-1} x</math>. By integration by parts, set <math>\displaystyle u = \arctan x</math> and <math>\displaystyle dv = dx</math>. Then <math>\displaystyle du = \frac{1}{1+x^2} \ dx</math> and <math>\displaystyle v = x</math>. Then

:<math> 
\displaystyle 
\begin{align}
\int_0^1 \arctan x \ dx & = x\arctan x \big|_0^1 - \int_0^1 \frac{x}{1+x^2} \ dx \\
& = \arctan(1)-\frac{1}{2}\ln|1+x^2|\big|_0^1 \\
& = \frac{\pi}{4}-\frac{1}{2}\ln 2
\end{align}
</math>
